52SMXPaWTWlEjSDgwn2W9g.text: High fives go to O Comptoir for being one of the few restaurants open in Boat Quay on Sundays!I finally stopped here to try their much talked about crepes and I was not disappointed. These babies take up an entire square plate, and halfway through I was kinda regretting ordering the potato wedges as appetizer. My "79" crepe had potatoes, bacon, onion and Reblochon cheese, and although the hefty $21 price tag had me worried for a bit, it pulled through by getting me surprisingly full. If you're not into crepes, they do have a brasserie section where you can order other mains like tuna and asparagus (great if you're avoiding carbs) and a burger (which our other friends ordered- looked pretty good!)Next time, I'll avoid ordering the wedges and stick with a crepe and perhaps a dessert crepe to end my meal- I really want to get the Nutella one next time!

photos.caption: Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. "The 79": potatoes, bacon, onion, Reblochon cheese. $21
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Tuna and asparagus main dish
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Potato wedges

1DiN5disvrKkAu3ytK0-kw.text: If you're tourist looking for a place for a quick snack try here. It's not the most popular neighborhood but does the job.Crepes are the specialty and has a cool atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore

9i9j7gkKFVC2Js1LhLvlRw.text: Finally found a French crepes place! Daily lunch sets on weekdays are good value for money. Located at Circular Road area, in a quaint shophouse where you can have brunch all through dinner. There's also a bar where you can have drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Salted caramel sweet crepes. Each morsel is heavenly.
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Khao San Road. A delicious blend of east meets west! Shrimps, mango and bean sprouts. With a sunny side up egg. Just perfect.
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Lunch set. Galette with garden salad. #yummilicious and #valueformoney

nMSm-L_coiAit68qzkTW8g.text: $16++ 3 course crepe lunches, this is truly a fantastic mid-day treat. A wide choice of crepe selection, I usually go for the No. 5 which is filled with all the ingredients that include ham, cheese, mushroom, tomatoes and a sunny side up egg. Appetizer is a garden salad and dessert is a trio of small bites that includes Apple crepe, chocolate puff and caramel crepe. The crepes are really good with nice crisp edges and a good amount of filling. The desserts though are small bites but are very satisfying. A great place to chill during lunch to catch a breather. Though filled with guests, it's not too crowded.

jKHytlxqBZ0oHUMAEG9fBA.text: I think the crepe is better than those I recently ate in France! Don't kill me.The flour is savory and crispy, and just the right amount of thickness. The crepe is stuffed with jamon, two types of cheese, mushrooms and tomatoes. Plus a runny egg...which makes everything heavenly. They have great lunch sets that comes with a salad and a dessert. The dessert was disappointing as it was a sweet crepe that is much too thick. I can't even figure out what is in the crepe.Super chill out vibe at a corner shophouse where Archipelago used to be.

photos.caption: Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Crepe with ham, mushrooms, egg, tomato and emmentel cheese
Photo of O Comptoir - Singapore, Singapore. Green salad that is part of the crepe set lunch

A5B3S8AvUCI55dWheC-rcQ.text: The galette are delicious. Tried the burger today, medium rare, no bacon. Easily the best burger in Singapore. Best burger I've had in years.

Z01TUT46S2ar1Wj_MiMkPA.text: YUMM!! Great food and drinks with wait staff that are attentive (very hard to find in Singapore). Drink pours are a little smaller than I expected, but the cider is delicious.

Jw-89EI9eg8KO2zy7EmisQ.text: Good cider and ambiance. I want to go back and try the crepes.

tsSE8lp_ZpCqTZv7Zq7B0w.text: 11 of us went to O Comptoir for ladies night. They have a very good promotion of wine for ladies. I tried the classic crepe and truffle fries; was happy with both. But above all, service was amazing - our waiter was fast, polite and funny. Reasonable prices were another bonus.
